III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance was provided to the agency relative to completion of
Initial Service and Updated Service Plans. Clarification was provided
regarding requirements for report writing when youth change placements
within the Whaley organization. The TA was provided to assist the agency in
ensuring that case files have clear documentation of initial service plans,
updated service plans and discharge summaries when a change of placement
occurs within the agency.

V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• None at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
The agency provided updated financial statements.
There are no financial concerns based on the review of Whaley Children's Center -
Zonta House budget and financial audit,
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment report dated June 24, 2024 was reviewed. Chief
Administrator and Zonta House leadership team found compliance with licensing
rules. Zonta House continues to utilize trauma informed care and practices. A
wider range of trauma informed training along with added trainings on suicide
prevention, working with LGBTQ+ youth, cyber security and promoting normalcy in
foster care trainings was previously added to their training program and both staff
and youth are adjusting to the benefits. Therapeutic Crisis Intervention refreshers
continue to be offered quarterly to continue their trend in decreasing restraints.
Zonta House remains accredited through CARF through October 2024.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff were interviewed on June 25, 2024 and July 3, 2024. Staff did not report any
concerns or training needs.

Youth were interviewed on June 25, 2024. A total of three youth placed at Zonta
house were interviewed.
No safety concerns were noted, and the Youth provided positive feedback
regarding the home environment and staff interactions.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Onsite inspection and walk through of Zonta House and Whaley Children's Center
administrative office took place on June 25, 2024. There are no safety issues or
concerns.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
